intro: Dalucum ramosum, commonly known as the branched moss vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
